other_tests.findings: Poorly differentiated malignant cells, but no differentiation between metastatic melanoma and primary bone sarcoma could be made.
High-grade osteoblastic osteosarcoma occurring in a background of long-standing fibrous dysplasia.
No obvious metastatic lesions detected in the lungs; benign-appearing lytic lesion with a sclerotic margin in the right scapular neck.
The appearance of a fluid-density lesion in the supraspinatus muscle remained unchanged.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No changes in the appearance of the lesion.

other_tests.findings: Confirmed the biopsy diagnosis of high-grade osteosarcoma arising in fibrous dysplasia.
Osseous union at the junction between the allograft and the native bone was delayed, but the hardware held the allograft in good position.
Mixed lytic-sclerotic lesion of the right humeral neck, extending to the mid-diaphysis; additional smaller lesions in the glenoid and acromion.
Multiple, well-defined intra-muscular masses appearing hypointense on T1-weighted sequences, hyperintense on T2-weighted sequences, and slightly heterogeneous.
Some resorption of the graft proximally; radial head and hardware remained in good position.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Mild pain and tenderness at the radiocapitellar joint developing over time.
